oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Lecturing with props at Brigade Officers' School at Vanderbilt University
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Officer from the Tennessee State Guard standing at the front of the room. He has a rifle balanced on the lecturn and a target propped behind him that reads "Today - The Bull's Eye; Tomorrow - The Enemy."

On July 9, 1944, a school of military application was conducted at Vanderbilt University by U.S. Army officers of the Fourth Service Command for officers and staffs of the Second Brigade of the Tennessee State Guard. This would involve the 2nd, 7th, and 10th Regiments of the TSG.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Tennessee State Guard, 1941-1947
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Tennessee. Militia; Tennessee - History, Military; World War, 1939-1945
Military training; Militias; Military education
